title: Can the concept of “truth” exist independently from the concept of “falsehood”? When we say something is true, then does that mean something else must be untrue? - Quora

response.answer_text: Opposites are Truth and lie but when you ask Truth is independent. Obviously not. It is dependent on the lie to become truth and vice versa but there is Truth,which we call in mysticism, which is different from truth you are considering here. It contains both truth and lies in it. We call it Truth because that Truth is you but because we are in delusion of relativity which is nothing but time, we think there is duality in this world. But, there is no duality. Duality is illusion. This illusion is not dream but it is real but it is not the truth. It is created falseness Jiddu Eckhart Tolle sribagavath.org/ebooks/

Truth is just a personal experience. There are two versions of truth. One’s about the person who actually experiences it and the other one is what you hear through a second person. It's just about point of view. When you hear about a incident by someone else, the truth may be covered up by that person's opinion. It's like a game of chinese whisper. Sometimes a person actually experience it l, may not tell the fabricate the truth. So, what you perceive as a truth may be false for someone else.

A statement is true if it corresponds to reality. A statement is false if it fails to meet this criterion. Some truths, such as mathematical truths, cannot be otherwise ( 2 + 2 must always equal 4). However in the empirical realm what we believe to be true statements are in principle revisable based on new evidence. For example, it was for centuries believed that the “atom” was the indivisible fundamental substance of material reality Now we know there are underlying sub-atomic particles.

On the contrary….the truth CAN exist without a lie, and a lie cannot exist without the truth. You see, a lie is a false counterfiet of a truth and has no use unless it is incorrectly PERCEIVED to be the truth.

This is the law of all existance. Balance. Justice has to be served always. For example God doesn't allow bad things to happen to good people, but is the need of balance what allows this to happen. In order to be “good” people there has to be “bad” people, and how could bad people be bad if they didn't had nobody to be bad at? So this is why bad people are allowed to cause harm to good people. Same as as there is life, is also death. For every crime there is a punishment. And the list goes on. Day wouldn't be day if there was no night to difference one from another.
If something is true then its negation is false (at least on standard logic; there are some offbeat logics in which this isn’t true). So if p is T then not-p is F.
Yes, truth is independent of false. Truth is not a concept. Truth is reality. However, falsehood does indeed depend upon truth, for it is a corruption of truth.

Truth has nothing to do with falsehood. Truth is one of the three prime elements of supreme power called GOD. Truth always has quality of being eternal. Free from impurities and sovereign. That’s why in Hindu mythology truth or ‘Satya ‘ is equated to lord Shiva.
In relative world there cannot be truth without falsehood. In absolute world ther can be truth without falsehood.
